{{Use mdy dates|date=October 2016}} '''Celebrity comics''' are [[comics]] based on the fame and popularity of a celebrity.<ref name="Weyer, Geert 2014">De Weyer, Geert, "België gestript",Standaard Uitgeverij, 2014.</ref> They are a byproduct of [[merchandising]] around a certain media star or franchise and have existed since the mass media and [[comics]] came into existence in the 19th century. Celebrity comics are usually not held in high esteem by critics, because of their purely commercial nature. They are solely created to capitalize on media trends and therefore published so quickly and cheaply that drawings and narratives tend to be of very low quality.<ref name="Weyer, Geert 2014"/>
==Definition== Celebrity comics are usually written and drawn for commercial purposes.<ref name="Weyer, Geert 2014"/> Publishers try to cash in on the fame of a well known radio, TV, film star or series by launching a comic book or an entire comic book series about these media stars.<ref name="Weyer, Geert 2014"/> Comics about sports champions or theatrical actors fall in the same category. The line of thought behind these works is that the audience will be more likely to buy something they already recognize from theatre, film, radio or TV than a brand new series about an original creation.
Despite the commercial potential few of these celebrity comics last long. Their sales are usually based on the amount of attention a certain celebrity receives during a certain period. If the media craze or [[fad]] dies down the comic version usually fizzles out as well.<ref name="Weyer, Geert 2014"/> Another reason why many of these comics fail in the long run has to do with the fact that companies usually pass both the writing and drawing to less skilled artists, many of which don't have much experience in their profession. Apart from that the artists in question are put under pressure of a TV channel, company or the media star himself to follow their own demands and expectations as much as possible.<ref name="Weyer, Geert 2014"/>
Celebrity comics should not be confused with [[satire|satirical comics]] or political comics, which lampoon celebrities. While these can sometimes be made to play-off the fame of a celebrity, they usually tend to be less respectful towards the media stars in question and are seldom made with their own participation.
Despite the fact that celebrity comics are considered pure pulp some people have interest in these titles as a mere nostalgic or historical curiosity, of which they enjoy the [[campiness]].
==History== [[File:Leno magazine.jpg|thumb|upright|''Dan Leno's Comic Journal'', Issue No. 1, February 26, 1898]]
Celebrity comics have existed since the late 19th century. The earliest example was the magazine ''Dan Leno's Comic Journal'' (1898), based on the popularity of British [[music hall]] comedian [[Dan Leno]]. The paper was primarily aimed at young adults and featured a fictional version of Leno. He personally wrote most of the gags and stories, while [[Tom Browne (illustrator)|Tom Browne]] contributed many of the illustrations.<ref name=Anthony170>Anthony, p. 170</ref> The comedian retained editorial control of the paper, deciding which items to omit.<ref name=Brandreth70>Brandreth, p. 70</ref><ref>Brandreth, pp. 69–70</ref> After a run of nearly two years the novelty wore off, and Leno lost interest. The paper shut down on December 2, 1899.<ref name=Anthony170/><ref name=Brandreth70/> Another early example was a comic strip drawn between 1909 and 1913 about the local village eccentric [[Robert W. Patten]] by [[John Hager (cartoonist)|John Hager]], which was published in the [[Seattle Daily Times]].<ref name=newell>{{cite book|author1=Newell, Gordon |author2=Sherwood, Don|title=Totem Tales of Old Seattle| publisher=Ballantine|year=1974|isbn=0-345-24141-X}}</ref> When Hollywood started making [[slapstick]] films many comics series were made about popular film comedians. [[E.C. Segar]]'s ''[[Charlie Chaplin's Comedy Capers]]'' is perhaps the most famous example and ran for a solid two years, between 1916 and 1918. Between the 1920s and early 1960s the British magazines ''[[Radio Fun]]'' and ''[[Film Fun]]'' were even completely based around comics about radio and film celebrities. In the mid 1930s American artists like Alfred Buescher <ref>https://www.lambiek.net/artists/b/buescher_alfred-j.htm</ref>, Clifton H. Crittenden <ref>https://www.lambiek.net/artists/c/crittenden_clifton.htm</ref>, Roland Jack Scott, and Arthur J. Palmer also made [[text comics]] based on the lives of celebrities who made headlines at the time. When television became popular in the 1950s and 1960s it opened the door for a whole stream of comics based on popular TV shows and stars. In every country with a comics industry examples of celebrity comics can be found.
==Celebrity animated cartoons==
A subgenre is celebrity animated cartoon series, based on the popularity of a well known musical artist (''[[Hammerman]]''), band (''[[The Beatles (TV series)|The Beatles]], [[The Jackson 5ive (TV series)|The Jackson 5ive]], [[The Osmonds (TV series)|The Osmonds]], [[New Kids on the Block (TV series)|New Kids on the Block]]''), film stars (''[[The Abbott and Costello Cartoon Show]], [[Jackie Chan Adventures]], [[Amigo and Friends]], [[Laurel and Hardy (animated series)|Laurel and Hardy]], [[Mary-Kate and Ashley in Action]], [[Chuck Norris: Karate Kommandos]], [[The New Three Stooges]]'',...), TV star (''[[The Gary Coleman Show]], [[Partridge Family 2200 A.D.]], [[Mister T (TV series)|Mr. T]], [[Laverne & Shirley in the Army]], [[The Fonz and the Happy Days Gang]]'') and/or sports champion (''[[Harlem Globetrotters (TV series)|Harlem Globetrotters]], [[I Am the Greatest: The Adventures of Muhammad Ali]], [[Mike Tyson Mysteries]], [[Ronaldinho Gaucho's Team]]'',...).

{{Use mdy dates|date=September 2018}} {{Infobox person | name = Claire Wineland | birth_date = {{birth date|1997|4|10}} | birth_place = [[Austin, Texas]], U.S. | death_date = {{death date and age|2018|9|2|1997|4|10}} | death_place = [[San Diego]], California, U.S.<ref name="Claire's Place Foundation, Inc. via Facebook">{{cite web |title=Its been a very long few days and I wanted to give everyone an update on how Claire is doing. |url=https://www.facebook.com/clairesplace1/posts/1953851864653849?__xts__[0]=68.ARAnMrOBdLiVPCUx16WwevwwTi3gbRATl7bt_LP1gg6F7rpFeMajTGGZnpV7iIMnV3SXw7PTyQca8QyEsAEm9zuy-EDqUsShtmqxJLgHGHY31u2f6v2tPBfT4OaZ4cvJWWMExZwRyJKIPxU8tV5BZ2uq0RRZVJeYcPnjx2A-v1wuO5jt9ise2A&__tn__=-R |publisher=Claire's Place Foundation, Inc. via Facebook |accessdate=September 3, 2018}}</ref> | occupation = Activist, author | years_active = 2010–2018 | website = [http://clairesplacefoundation.org/ clairesplacefoundation.org] }}
'''Claire Lucia Wineland''' (April 10, 1997 – September 2, 2018) was an American activist and author. Through her non-profit organization "Claire's Place Foundation", she worked to support and organize people with terminal and chronic illness and their families.<ref name="CNN">[http://www.cnn.com/2017/07/05/health/claire-wineland-cystic-fibrosis-eprise/index.html Living while dying: 'Little Buddha' wisdom from a terminally ill 'goofball']. [[CNN]], July 5, 2017</ref><ref name="Bustle">{{Cite news|url=https://www.bustle.com/articles/178819-who-is-claire-wineland-the-my-last-days-subject-is-helping-others-live-their-best-lives|title=Who Is Claire Wineland? The 'My Last Days' Subject Is Helping Others Live Their Best Lives|last=Rosenfeld|first=Laura|access-date=2017-07-26}}</ref>
Wineland wrote the book ''Every Breath I Take, Surviving and Thriving with Cystic Fibrosis'' and was a [[TED (conference)|TEDx]] speaker.<ref name="CNN" /><ref name="Bustle" />
== Personal life == Wineland was born with [[cystic fibrosis]] in [[Austin, Texas]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://northstarmoving.com/blog/2010/meet-claire/|title=Meet Claire|publisher=North Star Moving|accessdate=September 3, 2018}}</ref> She enjoyed performing from a young age and appeared in ''[[The Music Man]]'' at age 4.<ref name="Bustle" /> At age 13, her lungs failed, and she was placed in a [[medically-induced coma]].<ref name=longer>{{cite web|url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/08/29/health/claire-wineland-transplant-stroke/index.html|title=A lung transplant gave her hope for a longer life; now her family prays for 'another miracle'|publisher=CNN|date=August 30, 2018}}</ref> She was given a 1% chance of survival and awoke after 16 days.<ref name=longer/> She then founded an organization in support of families affected by terminal illness, specifically cystic fibrosis.<ref name=CNN/> 
== Activism == Wineland founded the Claire's Place Foundation at age 13.<ref name=CNN/> Inspired by the community's support while she was in a coma, she launched the [[501(c)(3) organization|501(c)(3)]] non-profit to provide support to children with cystic fibrosis and their affected families.<ref name="Bustle" /> The foundation operates through two programs: Support Families, which offers personalized support and assistance in areas such as treatment, care processes and emotional support from other parent volunteers; and Extended Hospital Stay Grants which provide financial assistance to families who are struggling with extended hospital stays.<ref name="Bustle" /> Claire's Place Foundation has provided financial assistance to 26 families to date.<ref name="Bustle" />
Wineland was chosen to be the keynote speaker at [[AARC Congress]], the 63rd International Respiratory Convention and Exhibition.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.aarc.org/claire-wineland-congress-keynote/|title=AARC Congress Announces Claire Wineland As Keynote Speaker|date=2017-07-20|work=AARC|access-date=2017-07-26|language=en-US}}</ref> She was a TEDx speaker and has spoken at a number of conferences worldwide. Claire appeared in an episode of ''[[Red Band Society]]'' and in the documentary series ''My Last Days''.<ref name="Bustle" /> She joined the Philips "Breathless Choir" as a soloist.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://clairesplacefoundation.org/tag/breathless-choir/|title=breathless choir – Claire's Place Foundation|website=clairesplacefoundation.org|accessdate=September 4, 2018}}</ref>
=== The Clairity Project and YouTube channel=== The Clairity Project is a website featuring a series of educational videos and vlogs hosted on YouTube, which hope to inspire and educate others about living with a terminal illness.<ref name=CNN /> According to the website, Wineland's activism aims "to shed some light on what it's really like to be sick, and change the way we view illness and those living with it".<ref name=CNN/>
On August 7, 2017, after not uploading any videos onto her YouTube channel for over a year, Wineland made a return to YouTube with a new account under her real name. Her first uploaded video titled, "I stopped doing the Clarity Project because I got screwed over", revealed that The Clairity Project was not operated by her, but by a video editing company, and she had little to no control or input over the editing of her videos apart from its filming and creation. She revealed that after taking a break from creating videos for some months due to declining health, the company refused to allow her to log into any accounts relating to The Clarity Project. Due to no formal contracts over ownership of the project being in place, the company continued to profit from The Clairity Project, which essentially had her namesake, without Wineland ever having any control or seeing any profits. However, Wineland stated she does not have the energy or the money to take the case to court.<ref>{{cite web |author=Claire Wineland |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zeg83eig0BE |title=I stopped doing the Clairity Project because I got screwed over |work=Claire Wineland |publisher=[[YouTube]]|date=7 August 2017 |accessdate=9 September 2018 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180909072714/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zeg83eig0BE |archivedate=9 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Wineland continued to operate her very own YouTube channel where she uploaded personal vlogs regarding her personal feelings and thoughts, cystic fibrosis, her life expectancy and a [[Lung transplantation|lung transplant]]. She uploaded nine videos prior to her death.<ref>{{cite web|author=Claire Wineland |url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCTw8xGVrk4FTAJwMG6mw22w |title=Claire Wineland YouTube channel |work=Claire Wineland |publisher=[[YouTube]] |date=7 August 2017 |accessdate=9 September 2018 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180909073037/https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCTw8xGVrk4FTAJwMG6mw22w |archivedate=9 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
== Death == On August 26, 2018, Wineland had a stroke due to a [[Thrombus|blood clot]] which "cut off blood flow to the right side of her brain."<ref name=CNN2 /> She died, aged 21, on September 2, 2018, at 6:21 PM, at the [[UCSD Thornton Hospital|UC San Diego Thornton Pavilion]], one week after a double-lung transplant.<ref name=CNN2>{{cite web|url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/09/03/health/claire-wineland-obit/index.html|title=Claire Wineland, inspirational speaker and social media star, dies one week after lung transplant|publisher=CNN|date=September 3, 2018|accessdate=September 3, 2018}}</ref><ref name="Claire's Place Foundation, Inc. via Facebook" /> Her organs were donated to those in need.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/09/03/health/claire-wineland-obit/index.html|title=Claire Wineland, inspirational speaker and social media star, dies one week after lung transplant|last=CNN|first=Jessica Ravitz,|work=CNN|access-date=2018-09-04}}</ref>
== Legacy == In 2016, Wineland was listed as one of [[Seventeen (American magazine)|''Seventeen'' magazine's]] 17 Power Teens. She was a [[Fox Teen Choice Award]] Honoree in 2015<ref>{{Cite web|title=Meet the 2015 Teen Choice Pro-Social Honorees|url=http://www.teenchoice.com/article/2015-teen-choice-pro-social-honorees-0|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161109071733/http://www.teenchoice.com/article/2015-teen-choice-pro-social-honorees-0|archive-date=2016-11-09}}</ref> and received the Gloria Barron Prize for Young Heroes<ref name="Bustle" /> and ''[[Los Angeles Business Journal]]''{{'s}} Small Nonprofit of the Year Award in 2014.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=|first=|date=|title=Nonprofit & Corporate Citizenship Awards 2014|url=http://www.cbjonline.com/a2labj/supplements/NonprofitAwards_20140630.pdf|journal=Los Angeles Business Journal|volume=|pages=|via=}}</ref>

{{Infobox basketball biography | name = Damen Bell-Holter | image = | caption = | position = [[Power forward (basketball)|Power forward]] | height_ft = 6 | height_in = 9 | weight_lb = 245 | league = [[Serie A2 Basket|Serie A2]] | team = Fortitudo Agrigento | number = | nationality = American | birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1990|4|13}} | birth_place = [[Hydaburg, Alaska]] | high_school = [[Ketchikan High School|Ketchikan]] ([[Ketchikan, Alaska]]) | college = [[Oral Roberts Golden Eagles men's basketball|Oral Roberts]] (2009–2013) | draft_year = 2013 | career_start = 2013 | career_end = | years1 = 2013–2014 | team1 = [[Maine Red Claws]] | years2 = 2014–2015 | team2 = [[Pertevniyal S.K.]] | years3 = 2015–2016 | team3 = [[Lapuan Korikobrat]] | years4 = 2016–present | team4 = [[Fortitudo Agrigento]] | highlights = *First-team All-[[Southland Conference|Southland]] (2013) }} '''Damen Bell-Holter''' (born April 13, 1990) from [[Hydaburg, Alaska]]<ref>[https://www.celticsblog.com/2013/9/3/4688754/blessed-to-bless-damen-bell-holter-inspires-children-around-the-world-boston-celtics-nba-love "Blessed to bless," Damen Bell-Holter provides inspiration for children around the world - CelticsBlog] Retrieved 2018-04-01.</ref> is an American professional [[basketball]] player who currently plays for [[Fortitudo Agrigento]] of the [[Serie A2 Basket|serie A2]]. An [[Alaska Natives|Alaska Native]] and member of the state's [[Haida people]]s,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://indiancountrytodaymedianetwork.com/2013/09/17/hoop-dream-boston-celtics-invite-haida-big-man-bell-holter-camp-151322 |title=Hoop Dream: Boston Celtics Invite Haida Big Man Bell-Holter to Camp |publisher=[[Indian Country Today Media Network]] |date=September 17, 2013 |accessdate=April 14, 2016}}</ref> he played [[college basketball]] at [[Oral Roberts University]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Damen Bell-Holter Bio|url=http://www.orugoldeneagles.com/ViewArticle.dbml?ATCLID=1498471|accessdate=March 4, 2014|work=orugoldeneagles.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=O'Connor|first=Kevin|title="Blessed to bless," Damen Bell-Holter provides inspiration for children around the world|url=http://www.celticsblog.com/2013/9/3/4688754/blessed-to-bless-damen-bell-holter-inspires-children-around-the-world-boston-celtics-nba-love|accessdate=March 4, 2014|work=CelticsBlog.com|publisher=SB Nation|date=September 3, 2013}}</ref>
==Professional== Bell-Holter went undrafted in the [[2013 NBA draft]]. On August 7, 2013, he signed with [[Telekom Baskets Bonn]] of Germany for the 2013–14 season.<ref>[http://www.sportando.com/en/europe/germany/104728/telekom-baskets-bonn-land-damen-bell-holter.html Telekom Baskets Bonn land Damen Bell-Holter]</ref> However, he was later released by Bonn on August 28, 2013.<ref>[http://www.sportando.com/en/europe/germany/105518/damen-bell-holter-won-t-play-in-bonn.html Damen Bell-Holter won't play in Bonn]</ref>
On September 30, 2013, he signed with the Boston Celtics.<ref>[http://www.nba.com/celtics/news/press_release/celtics-finalize-training-camp-roster Celtics Finalize Training Camp Roster]</ref> However, he was later waived by the Celtics on October 26, 2013.<ref>[http://www.nba.com/celtics/news/press_release/celtics-waive-four Celtics Waive Four]</ref> On October 31, 2013, he was acquired by the [[Maine Red Claws]] as an affiliate player.<ref>[http://www.nba.com/dleague/maine/red_claws_announce_first_11_pl_2013_10_31.html Maine Red Claws Announce First 11 Players Invited to Training Camp] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150325092900/http://www.nba.com/dleague/maine/red_claws_announce_first_11_pl_2013_10_31.html |date=March 25, 2015 }}</ref>
On July 29, 2014, he signed with [[BC Körmend]] of Hungary for the 2014–15 season.<ref>[http://www.sportando.com/en/europe/hungary/129480/damen-bell-holter-agreed-to-terms-with-bc-kormend.html Damen Bell-Holter agreed to terms with BC Kormend]</ref> He later left before appearing in a game for them. On October 9, 2014, he signed with Pertevniyal İstanbul of the [[Turkish Basketball Second League]].<ref>[http://altyapihaber.com/pertevniyal-amerikali-pota-alti-oyuncusu.html Pertevniyal Amerikalı pota altı oyuncusu…] {{tr icon}}</ref>
On July 21, 2016, Bell-Holter signed with the Italian team [[Fortitudo Agrigento]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Fortitudo Agrigento announces Damen Bell-Holter|url=http://www.sportando.com/en/italy/serie-a2-ovest/207078/fortitudo-agrigento-announces-damen-bell-holter.html|accessdate=21 July 2016|date=21 July 2016}}</ref>

'''Elshad Islam oglu Abdullayev''' ({{lang-az|Elşad Abdullayev}}; born 25 September 1961, [[Kurdamir]]) is an [[Azerbaijan]]i lawyer and former university rector who gained wide popularity in 2012 after producing and publishing hidden camera videos, raising public and international awareness of [[corruption]] in the Azerbaijani government. The controversy that arose as a result came to be known as the '''Gulargate''' scandal, after former MP [[Gular Ahmadova]] of the ruling [[New Azerbaijan Party]], who featured in the first video.
==Early career== Abdullayev was born in the town of Kurdamir in central Azerbaijan where he received secondary education. In 1979, he graduated with an honors degree in law from the [[Baku State University]]. He received a master's and later a doctorate degree in law in [[Moscow]] in 1985 and 2000 respectively. He was the dean of the constitution law department of the [[Baku State University]] since 1995 and a professor since 2004. He is married and has three children.<ref>[http://dejure.az/elm-xadimleri/464-abdullayev-elad-slam-olu- Elshad Abdullayev]. DeJure Professional Law Firm.</ref>
==2005 parliamentary election campaign and voter bribery== Abdullayev joined the [[New Azerbaijan Party]] and unsuccessfully ran as a candidate in the parliamentary election of [[Azerbaijan parliamentary election, 2005|2005]]. Notably, his constituency of [[Binagadi|Binagadi II]] was among the five in which the voting results (according to which Abdullayev won) became void and new voting was scheduled for 2006.<ref>[http://news.day.az/politics/42964.html In By-Elections New Azerbaijan Party to Run with 5 Candidates]. ''Day.az''. 3 March 2006.</ref> However, a polling station official reported violations during the campaign, namely that Elshad Abdullayev had reportedly been bribing the electorate to gain votes. A criminal case ensued and the court was presented evidence, following which Abdullayev's candidacy was annulled.<ref>[http://news.day.az/politics/47654.html Elshad Abdullayev's Candidacy Annulled for Voter Bribery]. ''Day.az''. 29 April 2006.</ref>
In 2012, Abdullayev claimed that he believed he had in fact won the election, but that "certain powers" did not wish to see him in the parliament, as that would enable Abdullayev to expose the actions of a "criminal gang of kidnappers" who, he alleged, were responsible for the kidnapping of his older brother, Ministry of State Security officer Mahir Abdullayev, back in 2003 and poisoning of his younger brother Eldaniz Abdullayev who undertook a personal investigation of the kidnapping.<ref>[http://sehife.az/politika/2758-elshad-abdullaev-predstavil-novuyu-sensacionnuyu-videozapis-video.html Elshad Abdullayev Released New Feature Video] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121008223139/http://sehife.az/politika/2758-elshad-abdullaev-predstavil-novuyu-sensacionnuyu-videozapis-video.html |date=2012-10-08 }}. 4 October 2012.</ref>
==Controversies around the Azerbaijan International University== {{main|Azerbaijan International University}} In 1997, Abdullayev founded the Azerbaijan International University, a registered private institution for post-secondary education in [[Baku]], Azerbaijan. In 2006, the Attorney General's Office announced it had received reports of corruption taking place in the institution,<ref>[http://news.day.az/society/51708.html Republical Attorney General's Carried Out Investigation at Azerbaijan International University]. ''Day.az''. 22 June 2006.</ref> including proof of bribe-based student admission while passing over the official state admission examination.<ref>[http://news.day.az/society/126853.html Is Azerbaijan International University License Annulled?]. ''Day.az''. 7 August 2008.</ref><ref>[http://news.day.az/society/139966.html Maleyka Abbaszadeh: Just Beginning in September of This Year, 118 Bachelors of AIU Admitted Passing over SCSA]. ''Day.az''. 11 December 2008.</ref><ref>[http://news.day.az/criminal/138949.html Former Assistant Pro-Rector of Azerbaijan International University on Trial for Fraud]. ''Day.az''. 2 December 2008.</ref> As a result of a four-year-long investigation, the university was stripped of its license on the orders of Minister of Education [[Misir Mardanov]] on 30 August 2010.<ref>[http://news.day.az/society/226544.html Ministry of Education Shut Down Azerbaijani University]. ''Day.az''. 1 September 2010.</ref> Elshad Abdullayev disagreed with the Ministry's decision, claiming that his had received a four-year license in 2007 and that it could not have been simply revoked, but only expire.<ref>[http://www.azadliq.org/content/article/2164007.html AIU Rector Spoke Out]. Radio Liberty. 21 September 2010.</ref>
In 2010, former employees of the university were charged with illegal organ transplanting at the medical centre affiliated with the Azerbaijan International University.<ref>[http://news.day.az/criminal/265970.html Case of "Black Transplantologists" - from Baku to Pristina]. ''Day.az''. 6 May 2011.</ref> Abdullayev sought political asylum in [[France]] soon afterwards.
==Gulargate scandal== {{main|Gulargate}} In September 2012, Abdullayev accused government officials of Azerbaijan of having forced him to pay a 2,000,000-dollar bribe back in 2005 in return for finding his brother and obtaining a seat in the National Assembly. Neither even happened, according to Abdullayev, and the money was not returned to him. Abdullayev specifically accused the head of the Presidential Administration of Azerbaijan [[Ramiz Mehdiyev]] and claimed that Member of Parliament [[Gular Ahmadova]] helped broker the deal.<ref name="firstvideo">[http://www.azadliq.org/content/news/24719935.html A Video Accusing MP Gular Ahmadova Released]. Radio Liberty. 25 September 2012.</ref> After Ahmadova's denial, Abdullayev published a video on YouTube where he is seen discussing the bribe sum to be paid to Gular Ahmadova to be taken to higher authorities in return for a seat in the National Assembly and finding his kidnapped brother.<ref name="firstvideo"/> Abdullayev warned of being in possession of more videos, where names of President [[Ilham Aliyev]] and Minister of Emergency Situations [[Kamaladdin Heydarov]] are also mentioned.<ref>[http://www.azadliq.org/content/article/24728538.html Lawyer Cannot Find Investigator]. Radio Liberty. 4 October 2012.</ref> He also expressed concerns that instead of trying Ahmadova for extortion, Attorney General [[Zakir Garalov]] chose to persecute Abdullayev's family members in Azerbaijan in retaliation. He added that none of this would have been published, had the authorities established a neutral investigation commission.<ref>Rauf Orujov. [http://www.zerkalo.az/2012/gyulyargeyt-prodolzhaetsya/ Gulargate Continues]. ''Zerkalo''. 8 October 2012.</ref> Abdullayev released other videos in the course of the next few months, widening the controversy. He admitted that with these videos, he specifically targeted Ramiz Mehdiyev who had allegedly established "death squadrons" in 1994 that have been behind a number of controversial assassinations.<ref>[http://aspekty.net/2013/glava-administratsii-prezidenta-azerbaydzhana-gotovil-na-nego-pokushenie/ Head of President's Administration Planned His Assassination?]. ''Aspekty.net''. 21 January 2013.</ref>

{{Infobox person | name = Gene Porter Bridwell | image = GenePorterBridwell.jpg | image_size = 200px | caption = Official NASA portrait of Gene Porter Bridwell | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1935|10|4}} | birth_place = [[Linton, Indiana]] | death_date = | death_place = | education = Bachelor's degree in aeronautical engineering at [[Purdue University]] | occupation = Director of the
[[Marshall Space Flight Center]] | title = | spouse = | parents = | children = | nationality = | website = }} '''Gene Porter Bridwell''' was the seventh director of the [[NASA]] [[Marshall Space Flight Center]] located in [[Huntsville, Alabama]]. He served as director from January 6, 1994 to February 3, 1996. Before becoming director of the Marshall Center, G.P. (Porter) Bridwell served as manager of the Heavy Lift Launch Vehicle Definition Office, where he supervised efforts involving the proposed vehicle's design, development, and integration. He also served on special assignment with the Space Station Redesign Team and later the U.S./Russian Space Station Integration Team. Previously, he served as manager of the Shuttle Projects Office. There he managed the [[Space Shuttle|Shuttle]]'s propulsion elements, including the Space Shuttle Main Engine, External Tank, Redesigned Solid Rocket Motor, Solid Rocket Booster, Advanced Solid Rocket Motor, and related systems and activities, including the Michoud Assembly Facility. Bridwell was born in [[Linton, Indiana]], on October 4, 1935 and graduated from State High School in [[Terre Haute, Indiana]], in 1953. He earned a bachelor of science degree in aeronautical engineering in 1958 from [[Purdue University]], [[West Lafayette, Indiana]]. He began his professional career as an engineer with Rocketdyne in [[Canoga Park, California]]. He joined the Marshall Center in 1962, and his early experience included assignments within the former Saturn Systems Office and [[Saturn V]] Program Office. In 1975, he transferred to the [[Space Shuttle|Shuttle]] Projects Office and served in key positions including chief of the Project Engineering Office, and deputy manager of the External Tank Project. In February 1983, he was appointed manager of the External Tank Project. In the spring of 1987, he served temporarily as acting deputy center director of National Space Technology Laboratories in Mississippi. He was appointed director of institutional and program support at the Marshall Center in October 1988, and assumed the position of manager, Shuttle Projects Office, in May 1989. In January 1990, Bridwell became the director of National Launch Systems for NASA Headquarters, co-located at the Marshall Center. In February 1992, he was officially transferred back to the Marshall Center from headquarters, where he assumed his post as manager of the Heavy Lift Launch Vehicle Definition Office. == External links == * [http://history.msfc.nasa.gov/management/center_directors/pages/bridwell.html NASA biography] {{NASAMSFC}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bridwell, Gene Porter}} [[Category:NASA people]] [[Category:1935 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Directors of the Marshall Space Flight Center]] [[Category:People from Linton, Indiana]] {{US-gov-bio-stub}} {{NASA-stub}} {{Alabama-stub}}

Videoformes | website = {{URL|dontstareatthesun.com|dontstareatthesun.com}} }} '''govy''' (born 12 April 1981{{Cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/dontstareatthesun|title=Govy Govy|language=en|access-date=2018-04-03}}) is a French artist diagnosed on the [[Autism spectrum|Autism Spectrum]]{{Cite news|url=http://www.autostraddle.com/here-are-8-disabled-owned-businesses-you-can-support-349064/|title=From Fashion to Radical Art: 8 Disabled-Owned Businesses You Should Know About|last=|first=|date=2016-08-22|work=|newspaper=Autostraddle|language=en-US|access-date=|via=}} in 2013,{{Cite web|url=http://www.design-legends.com/legendary-designer.php?ID=134729|title=Design Legends - govy|last=|first=|date=2016-10-21|website=www.design-legends.com|publisher=|access-date=}} and is an advocate for the [[Neurodiversity|Neurodiversity Movement]]. She is the recipient of three [[A' Design Award]]s{{Cite web|url=https://competition.adesignaward.com/designer.php?profile=134729|title=A' Design Award and Competition - Profile: govy|last=|first=|date=|website=competition.adesignaward.com|publisher=|access-date=2016-11-01}} and two [[Videoformes|Videoformes Awards]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.nat.fr/videoformes/FESTIVAL/2007/Palmares/palmares.html|title=Videoformes 2007 Palmares|last=|first=|date=2007-03-13|website=www.nat.fr|publisher=|access-date=}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.nat.fr/videoformes/FESTIVAL/2005/sitefrancais/FESTIVAL/palmares2005.html|title=VIDEOFORMES 2005 PALMARES|last=|first=|date=2005-03-14|website=www.nat.fr|publisher=|access-date=}} Her work has been exhibited internationally at the Zendai MoMA{{Cite web|url=http://www.artlinkart.com/en/exhibition/overview/5f3axArl/type/solo/2008/03|title=Serial Bondage {{!}} exhibition|last=ARTLINKART|first=|date=2008-03-10|website=www.artlinkart.com|publisher=|access-date=}} of Shanghai, [[Triennale|Triennale Design Museum]] of Milan, WIELS Contemporary Art Center of Brussels,{{Cite web|url=http://www.wiels.org/en/residencieslist/53/jimmy-owenns-|title=Jimmy Owenns {{!}} Residencies|last=WIELS|first=|date=|website=www.wiels.org|publisher=|access-date=2016-11-01}} [[Casoria Contemporary Art Museum]] of Naples, Rosario Museum of Contemporary Art of Santa Fe (Argentina) and [[Nuit Blanche]] of Paris. Her first design piece, the "Yozakura sake set"{{Cite news|url=http://www.trendhunter.com/trends/sake-set|title=Cherry Blossom Sake Set|last=|first=|date=2014-05-27|work=|newspaper=TrendHunter.com|access-date=|via=}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.designboom.com/design/yozakura-sake-set-kennedy-james-sakura-charry-blossoms-05-23-2013/|title=yozakura sake set captures the essence of cherry blossoms|last=|first=|date=2014-05-23|work=|newspaper=designboom {{!}} architecture & design magazine|language=en-US|access-date=|via=}} can be found at the [[Museum of Modern Art|MoMA design store]] in NYC{{Cite web|url=https://store.moma.org/museum/moma/ProductDisplay_Yozakura-Sake-Set_10451_10001_240067_-1_26669_11520_240073|title=Yozakura Sake Set {{!}} Modern / Contemporary Barware {{!}} MoMA Design Store|website=store.moma.org|access-date=2016-11-01}} and Tokyo.{{Cite web|url=https://www.momastore.jp/momastore/products/detail/product_id/84416/|title=夜桜酒セット|last=STORE|first=モマストア {{!}} MoMA|website=www.momastore.jp|access-date=2016-11-01}} == Visual art == Govy is best known for her interactive art piece "Photographic Diary"http://www.dontstareatthesun.com/photographic-diary-20002001{{Cite web|url=http://alejandroalvarez-avt180.blogspot.fr/2012/04/photographic-diary-project-2001-by.html|title=the photographic-diary project (2001)|last=|first=|date=2012-04-07|website=alejandroalvarez-avt180.blogspot.fr|publisher=|access-date=}} (2000 – 2001) in which she took series of photographs every day during a year{{Cite web|url=http://classic.rhizome.org/artbase/artwork/2988/|title=Rhizome {{!}} Photographic Diary|last=|first=|date=2002-07-19|website=classic.rhizome.org|publisher=|access-date=}} and the series of [[Japanese bondage|Shibari]] [[Installation art|installations]]{{Cite news|url=http://animalnewyork.com/2012/tiny-victorian-armchairs-in-japanese-rope-bondage/|title=Tiny Victorian Armchairs in Japanese Rope Bondage|last=|first=|date=2012-01-23|work=|newspaper=ANIMAL|language=en-US|access-date=|via=}} "Serial Bondage"{{Cite news|url=http://design-milk.com/serial-bondage-by-kennedy-james/|title=Serial Bondage by Kennedy James|last=|first=|date=2012-01-27|work=|newspaper=Design Milk|language=en-US|access-date=|via=}} (2006 – 2013) which incorporates her peculiar fascination with Japanese rituals and aesthetics. Since 2015, govy has been focusing more on science and space art projects. She is mostly working on the concept of [[spacetime]]{{Cite web|url=http://www.yankodesign.com/2016/10/21/a-cosmic-selfie-for-your-birthday/|title=A cosmic selfie for your birthday!|last=Sheth|first=Sarang|date=2016-10-21|website=Yanko Design|publisher=|access-date=}} (or the [[Four-dimensional space|4th dimension]]) and a "specific individual human life in the bigger picture of the universe"{{Cite news|url=http://www.nubimagazine.com/kings-kickstarter-xii/|title=The Kings of Kickstarter XII {{!}} NUBI|last=|first=|date=2015-08-26|work=|newspaper=NUBI|language=en-GB|access-date=|via=}} with the "SpaceTime Coordinates" projects,{{cite web|url=http://www.spacetimecoordinates.com/|title=home|work=spacetimecoordinates.com|accessdate=13 January 2017}} which use data from [[Jet Propulsion Laboratory|NASA JPL]] to generate personalised art pieces.{{Cite news|url=http://www.trendhunter.com/trends/constellation-jewelry|title=3D-Printed Constellation Jewelry : constellation jewelry|last=|first=|date=2016-10-21|work=|newspaper=TrendHunter.com|access-date=2016-11-01|via=}}{{Cite news|url=https://i.materialise.com/blog/3d-printed-solar-system/|title=SpaceTime, a Personalized 3D-Printed Solar System|last=|first=|date=2016-10-20|work=|newspaper=i.materialise|language=en-US|access-date=|via=}} From 2001 until 2008, she has been using the artist name "Jimmy Owenns"{{Cite web|url=http://www.heure-exquise.org/auteur.php?id=1294&l=uk|title=heure exquise - jimmy owenns|last=|first=|date=|website=heure-exquise.org|publisher=|access-date=}} with the tagline "Artist Without a Sexual Identity". During this period she created the "Photographic Diary"{{Cite news|url=http://www.photophiles.com/index.php/les-articles-archives/lethemearchive/575-le-flou-le-dublement-de-la-figure.html|title=Le flou, le dédoublement de la figure|last=Bagot|first=Laurence|date=2005-11-15|work=|newspaper=Photophiles Magazine Photo|access-date=|via=}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.lexpress.fr/culture/livre/la-toile-et-moi_819517.html|title=La Toile et moi|last=|first=|date=2004-04-05|work=|newspaper=L'Express.fr|access-date=|via=}} an award winning interactive work that has been featured in the book ''Taschen’s 1000 Favorite Websites''{{cite web|url=https://www.taschen.com/pages/en/catalogue/architecture/all/03357/facts.taschens_1000_favorite_websites.htm|title=TASCHEN's 1000 Favorite Websites (Midi-Format) - TASCHEN Books|first=|last=TASCHEN|work=taschen.com|accessdate=13 January 2017}}{{Cite book|title=Taschen's 1000 Favorite Websites|last=|first=|publisher=Taschen|date=2003-11-01|isbn=3822825867|location=|pages=|quote=|via=}} A work on the notions about the splitting of the perception, narration or psyche and the search for identity.{{Cite web|url=http://www.brooklynartscouncil.org/documents/1452|title=Glitch Video Screening and Audio/Video Performance|last=|first=|date=2010-05-06|website=Brooklyn Arts Council|publisher=|access-date=}} In 2008, she adopted her second artist name "Kennedy James" and moved to NYC{{Cite news|url=http://next.liberation.fr/sexe/2012/02/02/chaises-ligotees-chaises-erotiques_793147|title=Chaises ligotées, chaises érotiques|last=|first=|date=2012-02-02|work=|newspaper=Libération.fr|access-date=|via=}} with an [[O visa|artist visa]]. Since 2015, she goes as "govy",{{Cite web|url=https://competition.adesignaward.com/design.php?ID=35248|title=Yozakura Sake Set|last=|first=|date=2014-06-16|website=competition.adesignaward.com|publisher=|access-date=}} her rare French family name. == Early work == Before debuting her visual work with photography, govy performed in a few theater, video pieces and films but then decided to focus on writing. In 1999, she published the first book on the internet that actually looked like a real book,{{Cite web|url=http://www.dontstareatthesun.com/press/#/tlramafr-2001/|title=telerama|last=|first=|date=2001|website=govy|publisher=|access-date=}} which would be published in 2001 under the title "Mes Cendres Nues"{{Cite book|title=Mes Cendres Nues|last=|first=|publisher=IDLivre|year=2001|isbn=2-7479-0036-3|location=Paris|pages=|quote=|via=}} by French publisher IDLivre. Her early wiritng is also part of the French Poetry Anthology "Les Nouveaux Poètes Français et Francophones",{{Cite book|title=Les Nouveaux Poètes Français et Francophones|last=French Poetry Anthology|first=|publisher=Edition Huguet|year=2004|isbn=2915412006|location=Paris|pages=179|quote=|via=}} published by Edition Huguet in 2004. In 2000 she started an interactive piece where she would photograph her daily life{{Cite journal|date=2002|title=Fotografías De Una Vida|url=http://www.dontstareatthesun.com/press/#/ciclo-2002/|journal=Ciclo|volume=}} during one year without interruption.{{Cite web|url=http://www.dontstareatthesun.com/press/#/readme-2002/|title=A Year of Emotions "Incarcerated" in a Photographic Diary|last=Yamada|first=Ryoji|date=2002-06-12|website=ReadMe|publisher=|access-date=}} This early piece launched her career as a visual artist{{Cite journal|last=Bagot|first=Laurence|date=2002|title=Photographic-Diary|url=http://www.dontstareatthesun.com/press/#/photophiles-2002/|journal=PHOTOPHILES|volume=}} as it was one of the first interactive pieces on the internet at the time and created before the fashion of photographic diaries via blogs{{Cite web|url=http://blog.ocad.ca/wordpress/cs07nl/online-art-project-review/?doing_wp_cron=1478021540.5767090320587158203125|title=Online Art Project Review {{!}} Carolyn's Blog|website=blog.ocad.ca|access-date=2016-11-01}} would start spreading worldwide in 2004.{{Cite journal|date=2004|title=Les Nouveaux Journaux Intimes|url=http://www.dontstareatthesun.com/press/#/lexpress-mag-2004/|journal=L’EXPRESS MAG|volume=}} In retrospect, it could be considered an art piece very much about growing up on the [[Autism spectrum|Autism Spectrum]] and struggling with a personal quest of identity. This work has received two awards and has been exhibited internationally in art galleries and museums. == Muse == In 2011, her face{{Cite web|url=http://number27.org/cowbird|title=Jonathan Harris — Cowbird|last=Harris|first=Jonathan|date=2011|website=number27.org|publisher=|access-date=2016-11-01}} launched the [[storytelling]] website [http://cowbird.com/ Cowbird],{{Cite news|url=http://blog.wired.it/misterbit/2012/03/02/jonathan-harris-cowbird-e-lanti-facebook.html|title=Jonathan Harris:|last=|first=|date=2012-03-02|work=|access-date=|via=}} with the first story{{Cite web|url=https://civic.mit.edu/blog/natematias/can-we-create-solitude-on-the-web-jonathan-harris-on-cowbird|title=Can we create Solitude on the Web? Jonathan Harris on Cowbird {{!}} MIT Center for Civic Media|last=|first=|date=2012-01-14|website=civic.mit.edu|publisher=|access-date=}} published "[http://cowbird.com/story/608/1000_Words/ 1000 Words]" written by Scott Thrift.{{Cite news|url=http://mediadecoder.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/02/19/pull-up-a-mouse-and-stay-a-while/|title=Pull Up a Mouse and Stay a While|last=Preston|first=Jennifer|date=2012-02-19|work=|newspaper=Media Decoder Blog|access-date=|via=}} [[The City and Horses]] pop band wrote a [https://thecityandhorses.bandcamp.com/track/my-strange-ways song] about their relationship in 2013. == References == {{Reflist|30em}} == External links == * [http://www.dontstareatthesun.com dontstareatthesun.com] Official Website * [http://govy.fr/ govy.fr] * [http://www.spacetimecoordinates.com/ spacetimecoordinates.com] {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:govy}} [[Category:1981 births]] [[Category:Artists with autism]] [[Category:Artists with disabilities]] [[Category:Autism activists]] [[Category:Feminist artists]] [[Category:French artists]] [[Category:French expatriates in Japan]] [[Category:French women artists]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People on the autism spectrum]]

{{multiple issues| {{Orphan|date=June 2013}} {{More citations needed|date=July 2012}} }} [[File:Hörður Barðdal.jpg|thumb|right|Hörður Barðdal]]
'''Hörður Barðdal (Hordur Barddal)''' (22 May 1946 in [[Reykjavík]] – 4 August 2009) was a competitive [[water polo]] player, competitive swimmer, competitive skier, competitive golfer, and a disabled athlete activist.<ref>Björnsson, Björn Jóhann. 2009. Andlát: Hörður Barðdal [Obituary: Hörður Barðdal]. ''Morgunblaðið'', 7 August 2009.</ref> His parents were Óli S. Barðdal, director of Seglagerðin Ægir, and Sesselja Guðnadóttir Barðdal. Óli died in 1983 but Sesselja outlives her son.
At the age of nine, Hörður contracted [[polio]], yet he never let his paralysis stop him at either work or play. His athletic achievements and his pioneering work within the sports arena speak of diligence, fighting spirit and positivity that inspired others in the same position with courage and eagerness to stand at an equal footing with able people.
During the years 1965–1970, Hörður played water polo with able athletes with Reykjavík F.C (KR) and he won the Reykjavík and Icelandic Championships several times in that area of sports. He was also a coach at the Reykjavík F.C. for a while, where he trained both able and disabled people in swimming. He was one of the first competitive athletes in the Reykjavík’s Sport Union for the Disabled (ÍFR) and he competed among other places at the Nordic Championships for the Disabled in 1976 and 1977 in swimming, where he won a bronze and silver medal. He was awarded the first Disabled Athlete of the Year in 1977,<ref>[No Author]. 2010. ''Hvati''. 20(2): 46.</ref> and he concluded his swimming career at the [[1980 Summer Paralympics]] in Arnhem, Netherlands.
Hörður was one of the founders of the Icelandic Sports Associations for the Disabled (ÍF) and was a member of the board of the Association until 1986. Hörður was often a team mangager at large sport events, for instance at the 1994 Winter Paralympics in Lillehammer; he was an integral player in the launch of winter sports for the disabled in Iceland.<ref>Bachmann, Guðný. 2011. ''Einn sá flottasti í brekkunum: Skíðaiðkun fatlaðs fólks – greinargerð'' [One of the Awesomest in the Hills: Disabled People's Skiing – A Report], pp. 18–19. Reykjavík: University of Iceland M.Ed. Thesis.</ref> He received the gold award from the Icelandic Sports Association for the Disabled in the year 1994 for his efforts to promote sports among the disabled.<ref>Lúðvíksson, Sveinn Áki. 2009. ''Hvati'' 19(2): 9.</ref>
During the last years, it was golf that totally captured Hörður’s heart, and he carried out groundbreaking work in enhancing disabled people’s appreciation of the sport. He founded the Icelandic Disabled Golf Association (GSFÍ), in collaboration with the Icelandic Golf Association (GSÍ), and was the president of the board until his untimely death in 2009.<ref>Einarsdóttir, Hildur. 2004. Yfirvinnum hindranir fatlaðra [Overcoming Hindrances for the Disabled]. ''Morgunblaðið'', 6 February 2004.</ref> He was also a board member of the European Disabled Golf Association (EDGA), who decided, in the fall 2010, to commission a trophy in his memory, "The Hordur Barddal Trophy",<ref>Pals, Sigi. 2010. Ein Engel, der sich vergoldet hat. ''Zeitung'', 7 October 2010.</ref> which has been awarded since in both male and female categories.
Hörður married Bergþóra Sigurbjörnsdóttir in the year 1968 but their ways parted. They had three daughters together: Jóhanna Ingileif, Sesselja Engilráð and Bergþóra Fanney Barðdal. He then married Soffía Kristín Hjartardóttir in the year 1980. Soffía died in 2007. Hörður’s stepson from his marriage with Soffía is Þórður Vilberg Oddsson. The grandchildren are nine in total.
The Hörður Barðdal’s Memorial Fund for Disabled Golfers was founded in the summer 2011 by Hörður’s mother, his three daughters, Kristmann Magnússon, director of Pfaff in Iceland, the Icelandic Sports Association for the Disabled, and the Icelandic Golf Association.<ref>''Stjórnartíðindi'' [Iceland's Legal Gazette]. 2011. Skipulagsskrá fyrir minningarsjóð Harðar Barðdal til styrktar fötluðum kylfingingum. 2011(690): Published on 8 July 2011.</ref>

{{EngvarB|date=March 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=March 2017}} {{Infobox person | name = James Miranda Steuart Barry{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|p=218}} | image = Dr_James_Barry_(surgeon).jpg | caption = Barry, c. 1840s | birth_name = Margaret Ann Bulkley | birth_date = circa 1795 | birth_place = [[Kingdom of Ireland|Ireland]] | death_date = {{death date |1865|07|25|df=y}} | death_place = England, [[United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland|United Kingdom]] | other_names = James Miranda Stuart Barry | known_for = medical reforms, first successful Caesarean section in Africa | occupation = surgeon }} Dr. '''James Miranda Steuart Barry''' (c. 1795 – 25 July 1865) was a military surgeon in the [[British Army]], born in Ireland. Barry obtained a medical degree from the [[University of Edinburgh Medical School]], then served first in [[Cape Town]], South Africa and subsequently in many parts of the [[British Empire]]. Before retirement, Barry had risen to the rank of Inspector General (equivalent to [[Brigadier-general (United Kingdom)|Brigadier General]]) in charge of [[military hospital]]s, the second highest medical office in the British Army. Barry not only improved conditions for wounded soldiers, but also the conditions of the native inhabitants, and performed the first [[caesarean section]] in Africa by an Irish surgeon in which both the mother and child survived the operation. Although Barry's entire adult life was lived as a man, Barry was born Margaret Ann Bulkley and was known as female in childhood. Barry lived as a man in both public and private life, at least in part in order to be accepted as a university student and pursue a career as a surgeon, Barry’s birth sex only becoming known to the public and to military colleagues after death. ==Early life== Other than some personal correspondence, there are few sources of information about the non-military parts of Barry's life. The scant available evidence provides a skeleton onto which a great deal of myth and speculation has been added by various commentators. In his detailed research into Barry's early life,{{sfn|du Preez|2008}} Michael Du Preez states that Barry was born in [[Cork (city)|Cork]] in 1789, a birth date based on Mrs Bulkley's description of her child being fifteen years old in a letter dated 14 January 1805.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|p=5}} Various other sources give birth dates of 1792,{{sfn|Kubba|Young|2001|pp=352–356}} 1795, and 1799, but these incorrect dates are almost certainly the result of Barry later lying about age on official documents to aid passing as a man. Barry was the second child born to Jeremiah and Mary-Ann Bulkley, and was given the name Margaret Anne.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|p=5}} Mary-Ann Bulkley was the sister of [[James Barry (painter)|James Barry]], a celebrated Irish artist and professor of painting at London's Royal Academy. Jeremiah Bulkley ran the [[weigh house]] on Merchant's Quay, Cork. However, [[Anti-Catholicism|anti-Catholic sentiment]] led to his dismissal from this post. This and subsequent financial mismanagement left Mary-Ann and Barry without the support of either Jeremiah Bulkley (whose debts led to him spending time in [[City Marshalsea, Dublin|the Marshalsea]] prison in Dublin) or later the Bulkleys' married son John.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|p=7}} A third child appeared in the Bulkley family and was named Juliana. Although presented as being Barry's sister, it is likely that she was Barry's daughter as a result of childhood sexual assault, as the charwoman who discovered Barry's sex when laying out the body stated that [[Stretch marks|pregnancy stretch marks]] were present.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|pp=7,8}} The teenage Barry was educated with the prospect of becoming a [[governess|tutor]], but given a lack of evidence of any work history, the Bulkleys appear to have struggled to find Barry any suitable tutoring positions.{{sfn|du Preeze|Dronfield|2016|pp=43-45}} A conspiracy appears to have developed between Barry, Mary-Ann Bulkley and some of the late James Barry's influential, liberal-minded friends (General [[Francisco de Miranda]], Dr [[Edward Fryer]], who had become Barry's personal tutor, and Daniel Reardon, the family's solicitor) to enable the teenage Barry to enter medical school.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|p=56}} The [[University of Edinburgh]] was chosen and Mary-Ann and Barry boarded a [[Leith]] [[Smack (ship)|smack]] on 30 November 1809.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|loc=pp. 62–63 reproducing a letter dated 14 December 1809 from Mary-Ann to Daniel Readon}} And so, Margaret Anne Bulkley became James Barry, nephew of the late [[James Barry (painter)|James Barry RA]] the Irish romantic painter and remained known thus for the next 56 years.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|pp=58–60}} In a letter to Daniel Readon, sent on 14 December, Barry asked for any letters addressed to Margaret Bulkley to be forwarded to Mary-Ann Bulkley (whom Barry now refers to as "my aunt"), and mentions that '...it was very usefull {{sic}} for Mrs. Bulkley (my aunt) to have a Gentleman to take care of her on Board Ship and to have one in a strange country...'. Although the letter was signed "James Barry", the solicitor indiscreetly wrote on the back of the envelope 'Miss Bulkley, 14 December'; this crucial piece of evidence was the one which enabled researchers to finally confirm that Margaret Bulkley and James Barry were one and the same.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|pp=407}} Arriving in Edinburgh in November 1809, Barry began studies at the [[University of Edinburgh Medical School|Medical School]] as a 'literary and medical student'. Barry's short stature, unbroken voice, delicate features and smooth skin led many to suspect that Barry was a young boy not past puberty, and the University Senate initially attempted to block Barry's application for the final examinations due to this apparent youth.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|pp=75–77}} However, the [[David Erskine, 11th Earl of Buchan|Earl of Buchan]], a friend of Dr Fryer and Barry's late namesake, persuaded the Senate to relent and Barry qualified [[Doctor of Medicine|''Medicinae Doctor (MD)'']] in 1812.{{sfn|Barry|1812|p=}}{{efn|Barry's thesis was about [[Femoral hernia]], a condition that is much more common in women than men}} Barry then moved back to London, signing up for the Autumn Course 1812/1813 as a pupil of the United Hospitals of [[Guy's Hospital|Guy's]] and [[St Thomas' Hospital|St Thomas']], whose teachers included [[Henry Cline]] and celebrated surgeon [[Astley Cooper]].{{sfn|du Preeze|Dronfield|2016|pp=82–93}} On 2 July 1813, Barry successfully passed the examination of the [[Royal College of Surgeons of England]].{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|pp=97–100}} ==Career== [[Image:James Barry (surgeon)05.jpg|thumb|left|Portrait of James Barry, painted circa 1813–1816]] Upon joining the army, Barry was commissioned as a Hospital Assistant in the British Army on 6 July 1813, taking up posts in Chelsea and then the [[HMNB Devonport|Royal Military Hospital in Plymouth]], achieving a promotion to Assistant Surgeon to the Forces, equivalent to lieutenant, on 7 December 1815.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|pp=101–105}}{{London Gazette|issue=17096|page=4|date= 2 January 1816}}{{London Gazette|issue=17106|page=205|date=3 February 1816}} Following this military training, Barry was posted to [[Cape Town]], South Africa in 1816.{{sfn|Kubba|Young|2001|p=352}}{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|pp=115–118}} Through Lord Buchan, Barry had a letter of introduction to the Governor, [[Lord Charles Somerset|Lieutenant General Lord Charles Henry Somerset]].{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|p=119}} Following the successful, even spectacular, treatment of Lord Charles's sick daughter, Barry was welcomed into the family,{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|p=123}} maintained a close friendship with the Governor, and became his personal physician. In 1822 Somerset appointed Barry as Colonial Medical Inspector,{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|p=167}} an extraordinary jump in expectations from Barry's low military rank which brought with it great responsibility. Over ten years of work in the Cape, Barry effected significant changes, among them improvements to sanitation and water systems, improved conditions for slaves, prisoners and the mentally ill, and provision of a sanctuary for the leper population. Barry also performed one of the first known successful [[Caesarean section]]s in which both mother and child survived;{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|pp=215, 216}} the child was christened [[James Barry Munnik]] in Barry's honour, and the name was passed down through the family, leading to Barry's name being borne by a later Prime Minister of South Africa, [[J. B. M. Hertzog]]. Barry also gained enemies by criticising local officials and their handling of medical matters, but the advantage of a close relationship with the Governor meant that the repercussions of these outspoken views were usually smoothed over. Barry was promoted to Surgeon to the Forces on 22 November 1827.{{London Gazette|issue=18424|page=2582|date=18 December 1827}} Barry's subsequent posting was to [[Mauritius]] in 1828. In 1829, Barry risked a great deal of trouble by going absent without leave to return to England and treat Somerset, who had fallen ill, and remained there until his death in 1831.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|pp=228,231}} Barry's subsequent posting was to [[Jamaica]], and then the island of [[Saint Helena]] in 1836. At St Helena, one clash with a fellow army surgeon resulted in Barry being arrested and [[court-martial]]led on a charge of "conduct unbecoming of the character of an Officer and a Gentleman". Barry was found not guilty, and honourably acquitted.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|pp=268–271}} In 1840 Barry was posted to the [[Leeward Islands]] and [[Windward Islands]] of the West Indies, there focusing on medicine, management and improving the conditions of the troops, and receiving a promotion to [[Principal Medical Officer]]. In 1845, Barry contracted [[yellow fever]] and left for England for sick leave in October. After being cleared for duty, Barry was posted to [[Malta]] in 1846. Here Barry was severely reprimanded for inexplicably taking a seat in the local church that was reserved for the clergy, and had to deal with the threat - and eventual actuality - of a [[cholera]] epidemic, which broke out in 1850.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|loc= pp. 251, 252 citing Bradford, Edward, 'The Reputed Female Army Surgeon', The Medical Times and Gazette vol. II for 1865, p. 293.}} The following posting was to [[Corfu]] in 1851, which brought with it a promotion to the rank of Deputy Inspector-General of Hospitals on 16 May, equivalent to [[lieutenant colonel]].{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|loc= pp. 251, 252 citing Bradford, Edward, 'The Reputed Female Army Surgeon', The Medical Times and Gazette vol. II for 1865, p. 293.}}{{London Gazette|issue=21210|page=1296|date=16 May 1851}} From here, Barry temporarily visited the [[Crimea]] on leave - as a request to be posted there officially had been denied - where a famous altercation took place between Barry and [[Florence Nightingale]] at [[Selimiye Barracks|Scutari Hospital]]. Finally, in 1857 Barry was posted to Canada, and granted the local rank of [[Inspector General#United Kingdom|Inspector General]] of Hospitals (equivalent to [[Brigadier General]]) on 25 September.{{London Gazette|issue=6740|page=873|date=29 September 1857|city=Edinburgh}} In that position, Barry fought for better food, sanitation and proper medical care for prisoners and [[Leprosy|lepers]], as well as soldiers and their families.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|loc= pp. 251, 252 citing Bradford, Edward, 'The Reputed Female Army Surgeon', The Medical Times and Gazette vol. II for 1865, p. 293.}} This local rank was confirmed as substantive on 7 December 1858.{{London Gazette|issue=22214|page=5589|date=31 December 1858}} [[File:James Barry (surgeon)01.jpg|thumb|right|Barry (left) with John, a servant, and Barry's dog Psyche, c. 1862, Jamaica]] Wherever Barry served across the [[British Empire]], improvements were made to sanitary conditions and the conditions and diet of both the common soldier and other, under-represented groups. Barry was outraged by unnecessary suffering, and took a heavy-handed and sometimes tactless approach to demanding improvements for the poor and underprivileged which often incited anger from officials and military officers; on several occasions Barry was both arrested and demoted for the extremity of this behaviour. Barry held strict and unusually modern views about nutrition, being completely [[Vegetarianism|vegetarian]] and [[Teetotalism|teetotal]], and, while keeping most personal relationships distant, was very fond of pets, particularly a beloved poodle named Psyche.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|loc= pp. 251, 252 citing Bradford, Edward, 'The Reputed Female Army Surgeon', The Medical Times and Gazette vol. II for 1865, p. 293.}} Playwright Jean Binnie's radio play ''Doctor Barry'' (BBC, 1982) identified John Joseph Danson as the black servant Barry first employed in South Africa and who remained with Barry until the doctor's death.{{Cite web | title = Dr Barry | last = Binnie | first = Jean | work = BBC Radio 4 Extra | date = 1982 | accessdate = 2018-04-13 | url = http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b09yh0qg | quote = }} ==Death== Despite protesting the decision, Barry was forcefully retired by the army on 19 July 1859 due to ill health and old age, and was succeeded as inspector general of hospitals by [[David Dumbreck]].{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|pp=364-365}}{{London Gazette|issue=22289|page=2803|date=19 July 1859}} After a quiet retirement in London, Barry finally died from [[dysentery]] on 25 July 1865.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|pp=371–374}} The identity of the woman who discovered the truth of Barry's sex is disputed, but she was probably a charwoman who also laid out the dead.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|p=390-391}} The charwoman, after failing to elicit payment for her services, sought redress in another way; she visited Barry's physician, Major D. R. McKinnon, who had issued the death certificate upon which Barry was identified as male. The woman claimed that Barry's body had been biologically female and had marks suggesting Barry had at one point borne a child.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|pp=378–379}} When McKinnon refused to pay her, she took the story to the press, and the situation became public. It was discussed in an exchange of letters between George Graham of the General Register Office, and Dr McKinnon.{{sfn|Kubba|Young|2001|pp=354–355}}
Sir, It has been stated to me that Inspector-General Dr James Barry, who died at 14 Margaret Street on 25 July 1865, was after his death found to be female. As you furnished the Certificate as to the cause of his death, I take the liberty of asking you whether what I have heard is true, and whether you yourself ascertained that he was a woman and apparently had been a mother? Perhaps you may decline answering these questions; but I ask them not for publication but for my own information. Your faithful servant George Graham
McKinnon's response was as follows:
Sir, I had been intimately acquainted with the doctor for good many years, both in London and the West Indies and I never had any suspicion that Dr Barry was a woman. I attended him during his last illness, (previously for bronchitis, and the affection for diarrhoea). On one occasion after Dr Barry’s death at the office of Sir Charles McGregor, there was the woman who performed the last offices for Dr Barry was waiting to speak to me. She wished to obtain some prerequisites [sic in source, but has to be a slip for perquisites, "perks"] of his employment, which the Lady who kept the lodging house in which Dr Barry died had refused to give her. Amongst other things she said that Dr Barry was a female and that I was a pretty doctor not to know this and she would not like to be attended by me. I informed her that it was none of my business whether Dr Barry was a male or a female, and that I thought that she might be neither, viz. an imperfectly developed man. She then said that she had examined the body, and was a perfect female and farther that there were marks of him having had a child when very young. I then enquired how have you formed that conclusion. The woman, pointing to the lower part of her stomach, said ‘from marks here. I am a maried{{sic}} woman and the mother of nine children and I ought to know.’ The woman seems to think that she had become acquainted with a great secret and wished to be paid for keeping it. I informed her that all Dr Barry’s relatives were dead, and that it was no secret of mine, and that my own impression was that Dr Barry was a Hermaphrodite. But whether Dr Barry was a male, female, or hermaphrodite I do not know, nor had I any purpose in making the discovery as I could positively swear to the identity of the body as being that of a person whom I had been acquainted with as Inspector-General of Hospitals for a period of years. Yours faithfully, D.R. McKinnon
After the matter was made public, many people claimed to have "known it all along". The British Army, seeking to suppress the story, sealed all records of Barry for the next 100 years. The historian Isobel Rae gained access to the army records in the 1950s, and concluded that James Barry the painter was indeed Barry's uncle. Barry was buried in [[Kensal Green Cemetery]] under the name ''James Barry'' and full military rank. It was claimed by several sources that the manservant who always attended Barry returned to [[Jamaica]], but his actual fate is unknown. ==Gender and personal life== In a letter chiding John Bulkley, Barry's older brother, for abandoning legal studies for the military, 19-year-old Barry wrote: "Was I not a girl I would be a Soldier!".{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|p=50}} Barry's interest in medicine was probably encouraged by the liberal-minded friends of the late [[James Barry (painter)|James Barry]] RA, and just before travelling to Edinburgh to enrol as a medical student in 1809, Barry assumed a male identity.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|p=51, 59}} A short stature, slight build, unbroken voice, delicate features and smooth skin led others to suspect that Barry was not a man but a [[Preadolescence#Prepubescence, puberty and range|pre-pubescent]] boy.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|pp=75, 76}} This identity was maintained through surgical training and recruitment into the [[British Army]] which, at officer rank level, did not then require a medical examination.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|p=101}} During Barry's first posting abroad to Cape Town in South Africa, Barry became a close friend of the Governor, Lord Charles Somerset, and his family. It has been suggested that Lord Charles discovered Dr Barry's secret and that the relationship was more than friendship.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|p=154}} Their closeness led to rumours and ultimately an accusation briefly appearing on a bridge post in Cape Town on 1 June 1824 saying that the writer had "detected Lord Charles buggering Dr Barry",{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|p=182}} which led to a court trial and investigation, as [[homosexuality]] was at that time strictly illegal. Despite these allegations, if Somerset was aware of Barry's sex, he did not reveal it. Despite efforts to appear masculine, witness reports comment on Barry's effeminacy{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|p=125}} and on a somewhat contradictory reputation - Barry had a reputation for being tactless, impatient, argumentative and opinionated,{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|loc= pp. 251, 252 citing Bradford, Edward, 'The Reputed Female Army Surgeon', The Medical Times and Gazette vol. II for 1865, p. 293.}} but was also considered to have had a good [[Doctor-patient relationship#Bedside manner|bedside manner]] and famous professional skill. Barry's temper and bravado led to a famous pistol duel with Captain [[Abraham Josias Cloëté|Josias Cloete]] of the 21st Light Dragoons. Barry's aim was better, the bullet striking Cloete's [[shako]] military cap and removing its peak, which dissipated its force.{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|pp=155–159}} During the [[Crimean War]] (1854–1856), Barry got into an argument with [[Florence Nightingale]]. After Barry's death Nightingale wrote that:
I never had such a blackguard rating in all my life – I who have had more than any woman – than from this Barry sitting on his horse, while I was crossing the Hospital Square with only my cap on in the sun. "He" kept me standing in the midst of quite a crowd of soldiers, Commissariat, servants, camp followers, etc., etc., every one of whom behaved like a gentleman during the scolding I received while "he" behaved like a brute . . . After "he" was dead, I was told that (Barry) was a woman . . . I should say that (Barry) was the most hardened creature I ever met.
Barry would never allow anyone into the room while undressing, and repeated a standing instruction that "in the event of his death, strict precautions should be adopted to prevent any examination of his person"{{sfn|du Preez|Dronfield|2016|loc= pp. 251, 252 citing Bradford, Edward, 'The Reputed Female Army Surgeon', The Medical Times and Gazette vol. II for 1865, p. 293.}} and that the body should be "buried in [the] bed sheets without further inspection",{{sfn|Loudon|2002|p=}} indicating a desire to conceal physical sex both in life and in death. ''We Are Family,'' an LGBT magazine, argues that this is strong evidence of Barry's having been a transgender man, given that "his wish was to die and be remembered as a man." == Intersex controversy == {{harvnb|Kubba|Young|2001|p=355}} picked up on Major McKinnon's statement that he did not know whether Barry was "male, female or hermaphrodite" and suggested that it might be more appropriate to say that Barry was "[[hermaphrodite]]" [or [[intersex]]] rather than "female", and "may have had ambiguous genitalia". These suppositions are based on the premise that "Concealment of one's sex for ... 40 years in the British Army, is simply unbelievable". However, {{harvnb|du Preez|Dronfield|2016}} show how Barry might have been able to conceal this secret from all but a few people, and those who did know did not reveal it while Barry was alive. N. Turner has commented on Kubba and Young's conclusion that the belief in an intersex condition was based on "vanishingly slim evidence". {{harvnb|Holmes|2003|p=}} also raises the possibility of Barry being intersex, but acknowledges the impossibility of knowing, expressing surprise that this is a problem for so many people. The suggestion that Barry may have been intersex has been criticised for both biological and social reasons. In a review of Holmes' biography, {{harvnb|Loudon|2002|p=}} firmly rejects the implication that Barry might have been intersex. {{harvnb|Funke|2017|p=}}, among other [[LGBT]] theorists, has voiced the opinion that the intersex theory is an attempt to impose "[[cisgender]] male" characteristics onto Barry so as to undermine the concept that a transgender man could have achieved as much as Barry did.{{sfn|Hacker|2001|p=}} ==In popular culture== The character of Barry has been played by [[Anna Massey]] in an episode of the BBC [[Docudrama|drama-documentary]] ''A Skirt Through History''. Barry's life is the subject of the historical novel ''James Miranda Barry'' (published in the United States as ''The Doctor'') by [[Patricia Duncker]].{{sfn|Duncker|2000|p=}} The Canadian aspect of Barry's career was dramatised in an episode of the series ''Heritage Television'', produced by then-independent superchannel CHCH in Hamilton, and hosted by Canadian historian [[Pierre Berton]]. A 2004 play, ''Whistling Psyche'' by [[Sebastian Barry]], imagines a meeting between James Barry and [[Florence Nightingale]]. As of April 2018, a film is said to by in early production, in which Rachel Weisz plans to produce and star, on the life of Dr. James Barry.{{cite web |first=Maureen |last=Dowd |authorlink=Maureen Dowd |title=Rachel Weisz Has a Big Surprise |website=The New York Times |date=2018-04-20 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/04/20/style/rachel-weisz-disobedience-movie.html |access-date=2018-04-26}} No further information on this has been made public beyond what Weisz herself has divulged via the sourced New York Times interview. ==See also== * [[Enriqueta Favez]], a woman who became a physician and surgeon while dressing as a man. ==Notes== {{notelist}} {{Reflist|30em|refs= {{cite web|author=Pain, Stephanie|date=6 March 2008|url=https://www.newscientist.com/article/mg19726462.000-histories-the-male-military-surgeon-who-wasnt.html|title=The 'male' military surgeon who wasn't|work=NewScientist.com|accessdate=16 March 2008}} {{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/magazine/8364465.stm#margaret | work=BBC News | title=Five British heroes overlooked by history | date=17 November 2009 | accessdate=5 May 2010}} |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20161115125956/https://www.eemec.med.ed.ac.uk/pages/james-barry |archivedate=15 November 2016 |df=dmy-all }} {{cite web|last=Leitch|first= Robert|date=1 July 2001|url=http://www.usmedicine.com/column.cfm?columnID=53&issueID=28|title= The Barry Room: The Tale Of A Pioneering Military Surgeon|work=usmedicine.com|accessdate=14 December 2007 |archiveurl = OF THE HOUSE OF LORDS: SESSION 1840|volume= Vol XL|title=Report of commissioners for inquiring into naval and military promotion and retirement|date=1840|publisher=Her Majesty's Stationery Office|location=London|page=199|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=RxJcAAAAQAAJ|language=en}} {{cite news |last=Maguire |first=Stephen |title=She's a beauty... and just perfect to play the role of the most amazing MALE doc ever; EXCLUSIVE HEARTACHE BEHIND NATASCHA'S SMILE. |url=http://www.thefreelibrary.com/She%27s+a+beauty...+and+just+perfect+to+play+the+role+of+the+most...-a0185669374 |accessdate=28 April 2013 |newspaper=Sunday Mirror |date=28 September 2008}} {{ODNBweb | title = Barry, James (c.1799–1865) | id=1563 }} {{cite web|title=Letter from Florence Nightingale to Parthenope, Lady Verney |date=n.d.|publisher= Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine|url=https://wellcomelibrary.org/item/b18367082}} {{Cite web | title = Dr. James Barry and the specter of trans and queer history. | author = | work = This Journey Without A Map | date = 24 November 2015 | accessdate = 2017-12-03 | url = https://acosmistmachine.com/2015/11/24/dr-james-barry-and-the-specter-of-trans-and-queer-history/ | quote = Even A Gender Variance Who's Who, which identifies itself as "the most comprehensive site devoted to trans history" doesn't even bring up the idea that Barry was trans. Instead they consider several theories put forth in the 1970s that suggest Barry was intersex. Which has nothing to do with anything as far as I'm concerned since intersex does not equal gender identity, either assigned at birth or lived }} {{Cite web | title = James Barry, unsung hero | last = Rota | first = Jess | work = We Are Family Magazine| issue= 6 | date = 2014 | accessdate = 2017-12-03 | url = https://wearefamilymagazine.co.uk/unsung-lgbt-heroes-james-barry/ | quote = }} {{cite web|url=http://ftvdb.bfi.org.uk/sift/title/509439|title=A Skirt Through History: An Experiment|work=BFI Film & TV Database|publisher=British Film Institute|accessdate=19 June 2008}} {{Cite web | title = Whistling Psyche, a CurtainUp London review | work = CurtainUp | last = Lopaz | first = Andrea | date = 18 May 2004 | accessdate = 2017-12-03 | url = http://www.curtainup.com/whistlingpsyche.html | language = | quote = }} }} ==References== {{Refbegin}} *{{cite thesis|first=James|last=Barry|title=Disputatio Medica Inaugralis, de Merocele, vel Hernia Crurali|trans-title=An inaugural medical dissertation concerning merocele or femoral hernia|language=latin|type=Doctoral thesis|date=1812|publisher=[[University of Edinburgh]]|id={{hdl|1842/417}} }} * {{Cite journal|last = du Preez|first = Hercules Michael|date = January 2008|title = Dr. James Barry:The early years revealed|url = http://www.samj.org.za/index.php/samj/issue/view/27/showToc|journal = [[South African Medical Journal]]|publisher = Health & Medical Publishing Group|volume = 98|issue = 1|pages = 52–54|postscript = .|ref = harv}}[http://www.scielo.org.za/scielo.php?pid=S0256-95742008000100025&script=sci_arttext Text.] [http://www.samj.org.za/index.php/samj/article/view/130/425 Pdf.] *du Preez, HM.
